business.headline: From UPI withdrawals to online corrections: 5 expected features of EPFO 3.0EPFO's upcoming system aims to enhance financial flexibility for employees with features like instant UPI and ATM withdrawals, auto-claim settlements, and expanded withdrawal reasons.

Meet Leena Tewari, the USV chairperson who bought India's costliest flatsLeena is the chairperson of USV, a Mumbai-based pharmaceutical company, which was started by her late father, Vithal Gandhi, in partnership with Revlon in 1961. Forbes estimates Leena's net worth at $3.9 billion, as of May 30, 2025, making her one of India's richest women.

Explained: Why Arshad Warsi, wife Maria Goretti were banned by Sebi for 1 yearArshad Warsi and Maria Goretti bought shares of Sadhna Broadcast Limited (now known as Crystal Business System Ltd) from other individuals who were also named in the Sebi order.

How Trump's tariff tsunami is reshaping global economyIn just over four months, Trump's flurry of trade actions, alternating between shock-and-awe tariffs and strategic pauses, has upended conventional expectations.

Waiting for Form 16? Here's when will you get it and what to checkEmployers are required to issue Form 16 to employees if they've deducted TDS from their salary. It consists of two parts and shows how much salary was paid and how much tax was deducted during the year.

Arshad Warsi, his wife, among 59 people banned from stock market for 1 yearSebi said the group was part of a scheme to artificially raise the price of Sadhna Broadcast shares before selling them to unsuspecting retail investors.

Veteran investor explains why most investors fail in marketsAce investor Shankar Sharma said many investors fail to ask tough questions and instead rely on myths. He was critical of the belief that great investors can see into the future, dismissing it as an unrealistic myth.

India GDP data to be released today: What should investors expect?Earlier this year, the National Statistical Office had estimated that India's economy would grow by 6.5% in 2024–25, with an expected growth of 7.6% in the March quarter.

Ola Electric shares nosedive 10% after Q4 net loss. Should you buy, hold or sell?Ola Electric's Q4 numbers have laid bare the challenges facing India's EV poster child, from falling volumes and margin pressures to delays in execution. While the company's aggressive bets on electric motorcycles and rural expansion could pay off, the near-term outlook is murky.

Mazagon Dock shares snap winning streak, tumble 8%. Here's whyThe stock fell to an intraday low of Rs 3,450, retracing from Thursday's close of Rs 3,749. Around 10:07 am, shares of the company were trading 4.75% lower at Rs 3,574.40.

Suzlon Energy share price up 13% over strong Q4 results: Should you buy?Suzlon Energy stock price: The shares jumped as much as 13% in early trade, reaching an intraday high of Rs 74.30 on the BSE. This rise comes after Suzlon Energy Ltd announced a sharp rise in its quarterly profit.

Explained: Why Suzlon Energy shares rose 13% after Q4 resultsThe sharp rally came after Suzlon posted a 365% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit for Q4FY25. Profit rose to Rs 1,182 crore from Rs 254 crore in the same quarter last year. Revenue from operations increased 73% to Rs 3,773 crore, compared to Rs 2,179 crore in the year-ago period.

entertainment.headline: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan gives off boss-lady vibes in new photos from Cannes 2025Aishwarya Rai Bachchan stunned in new photos from Cannes 2025. She gave powerful boss-lady vibes in a chic mauve pantsuit.

The Traitors trailer: KJo brings 20 contestants to compete in a high-voltage gameKaran Johar is set to host a new reality show 'The Traitors', premiering on Prime Video on June 12. Featuring 20 celebrities, the trailer promises intense drama, mind games, and thrilling twists.

Kamal Haasan's Thug Life banned in Karnataka amid Kannada language rowActor Kamal Haasan's upcoming film, 'Thug Life', has been banned by the Karnataka Film Chamber. This move came after the actor's 'Kannada is born out of Tamil' comment at the film's audio launch in Chennai on May 24.

Raj Kundra jokes about using nepo-husband card on The Traitors. WatchAt the trailer launch of The Traitors, Raj Kundra reflected on how public perception of his masked appearances might play to his advantage on the reality show. "Whenever I've worn a mask, people have wondered what I'm hiding. That mystery might help me in this game," he said. Calling The Traitors a show of deception and strategy, Kundra added with a laugh that he might even use the "nepo husband" card, since the show is hosted by his brother-in-law, Karan Kundrra.

Actor Surveen Chawla breaks silence on facing casting couch after marriageActor Surveen Chawla has opened up about facing casting couch experiences and inappropriate behaviour in the film industry, even after marriage. Despite these challenges, she continues to focus on her work and is set to appear in 'Rana Naidu' Season 2.
Ajay Devgn's Drishyam 3 in works? Viral post sparks buzzAjay Devgn's 'Drishyam 3' is believed to be in the works. A viral letter from the production house, Panorama Studios, has sparked buzz.

Uorfi, Raftaar to Rebel Kid: Meet 20 confirmed contestants for KJo's The TraitorsUorfi Javed, Raftaar and Apoorva Mukhija are among the confirmed celebs who are set to participate in Karan Johar's hosted, 'The Traitors'. The show will premiere on Prime Video on June 12.

Explained: Housefull 5's genius gamble of multiple climaxes, and how it works'Housefull 5' makers have introduced a new strategy - one film, multiple climaxes. But, what does this mean? How will it change the audiences' movie-watching experience?

Janhvi Kapoor likes reel questioning Madhuri Dixit's Filmfare win over SrideviJanhvi Kapoor sparked controversy after liking an Instagram reel that criticised Madhuri Dixit's Filmfare win and praised her late mother Sridevi's performance. The internet is divided, with many questioning whether the like was accidental or intentional.

Suriya-Jyotika's daughter Diya's school graduation pics trash family rift rumoursActors Suriya and Jyotika's daughter Diya has completed her schooling. The 'Dabba Cartel' actor shared photos from her daughter's graduation day featuring her grandparents.

Park Bo-gum, Kim So-hyun reunite after 10 years for new K-drama Good Boy'When Life Gives You Tangerines' actor Park Bo-gum and Kim So-hyun reunite after nearly a decade for JTBC's upcoming action-comedy drama 'Good Boy', premiering on May 31. The actors shared their excitement and praised each other's performances during the press conference ahead of the show's release.

BLACKPINK Jisoo's brother accused of illegally filming woman, agency respondsBLACKPINK fame Jisoo's brother was accused of secretly filming a woman during sexual activity, according to a viral post on Blind. The rumours surfaced on May 29. The company has issued an official statement.

Chidiya review: Tender tale of dreams, resilience and family bondsReleased-Fri May 30, 2025Chidiya movie review: 'Chidiya' is a heartfelt film about two brothers facing early adulthood challenges in Mumbai. It explores dreams, family bonds, and the resilience needed to overcome life's hurdles.

Preity Zinta looks disheartened after PBKS' loss to RCB, her reaction goes viralActor Preity Zinta's team, Punjab Kings (PBKS), faced a heavy defeat against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB), losing by eight wickets in Qualifier 1 of the IPL 2025 season.

Actors Divya Spandana, Vinodhini back Kamal Haasan in Kannada rowKamal Haasan found himself in the middle of a controversy after his 'Kannada is born out of Tamil' remark caused uproar among Kannadigas. While he is facing backlash from pro-Kannada groups, actors Divya Spandana and Vinodhini Vaidyanathan have expressed their thoughts on the same.

Ahaan Panday, Aneet Padda debut in YRF's Saiyaara, an intense love storyThe teaser of 'Saiyaara' marking the debut of Ananya Panday's cousin Ahaan is out. The film, directed by Mohit Suri, will release in theatres on July 18.

Justin Bieber reacts as wife Hailey's Rhode brand hits $1 Billion ValuationModel Hailey Bieber's skincare brand, Rhode, was acquired by e.l.f. Beauty for $1 billion. Her husband and singer Justin Bieber showed his quiet support to his wife.

Anushka-Virat's sweet moment after RCB win, actor celebrates team's victory. WatchAnushka Sharma was on cloud nine after husband-cricketer Virat Kohli's RCB team defeated PBKS and secured their spot in Qualifier one of IPL 2025. Take a look at the celebratory videos here.

Sumona Chakravarti enjoys sun, beach, bikini on Bali holiday, shares vibrant picsActor Sumona Chakravarti posted a few photos on Instagram, in which she could be seen making the most of her downtime at a beach in Bali.

general news.headline: Kamal Haasan defiant amid Kannada row: Will only apologise if I am wrongVeteran actor Kamal Haasan refused to apologise for his remark that "Kannada was born out of Tamil," stressing that he would only do so if he was wrong.

Rajnath Singh praises Navy's role during Op Sindoor: Pak ships didn't dare...Defence Minister Rajnath Singh visited INS Vikrant in the Arabian Sea weeks after its lead role in Operation Sindoor, which pressured Pakistan into a ceasefire.

Odisha engineer throws cash out of window during raid, Rs 2 crore seizedOdisha Vigilance seized Rs 2.1 crore in unaccounted cash from Chief Engineer Baikuntha Nath Sarangi's properties during raids across Bhubaneswar.

Ex-BJP leader's son, 2 others get life term for killing hotel receptionistThe Kotdwar court convicted Pulkit Arya, son of a former BJP leader, and two others in the 2022 Ankita Bhandari murder case after a 14-month trial.

Get rich fast or die trying: India's choice is a no-brainerFor India that aspires to be powerful, it has to become filthy rich. Money can't buy you love, but it can buy aircraft carriers and friends. For the money, India needs reforms, and PM Modi will have to channel his inner Manmohan Singh, and not the inner Nehru.

Sporting keffiyeh, Indian-American MIT student slams univ's Israel tiesDelivering a speech at MIT's 2025 graduation ceremony, an Indian-American class president denounced the university's ties with Israel and called for solidarity with Palestinians. Megha Vemuri sported a keffiyeh and said MIT students would never support a genocide.

Major problem, finally put to end: Congress leader praises Article 370 abrogationCongress leader Salman Khurshid, while interacting with a delegation in Indonesia, said the abrogation of Article 370 put an end to the perception that Jammu and Kashmir was a separate entity.
Hindu Kush Himalaya could lose 75% of glaciers, billions at riskThis stark projection shows the region's vulnerability and the far-reaching consequences for water security across Asia.

Disappointed: Shashi Tharoor on Colombia condemning Pak deaths after Op SindoorOn a five-nation tour, Shashi Tharoor told Colombia there is no parity between terrorists and victims, criticising Bogota's condolence message for Pakistani casualties after India's Operation Sindoor.
Indian man attacked by tiger while taking selfie in terrifying video from PhuketIn the viral video, the man is seen walking beside a tiger at the park before crouching to pose for a photograph.

'Should be deported': Vivek Ramaswamy's anniversary post faces racist backlashIndian-origin Republican leader Vivek Ramaswamy's anniversary post was bombarded with racist and anti-immigrant comments by X users over his views on the H-1B visa programme.

Ola, Uber, Rapido are being slammed for unfair practiceOla Cabs, Uber and Rapido's advance-tipping feature, using which users can ensure that they get a ride by paying a tip in advance, has come under government scrutiny over fair practices. Users have been slamming it too, calling it grossly unfair. Here's what the complaints are about.

Befriend, rape, blackmail: The MO of 'love jihad' gangs in BhopalThe modus operandi of these 'love jihad gangs' involve befriending unsuspecting Hindu girls, sexually exploiting them and then blackmailing them with obscene videos. A woman sub-inspector was among those trapped.

Destroyed Pak air bases in minutes, this is strength of new India: PMPrime Minister Narendra Modi, speaking at a rally in Bihar, said that Indian forces destroyed Pakistani airbases in minutes, fulfilling his promise to avenge the Pahalgam attack and showcasing the strength of a new India.

Did you see that coming? RCB ditch the drama with ice-cold nerves in Qualifier 1IPL 2025: RCB turned back years of painful playoff collapses with a performance that was all poise, no panic in the Qualifier 1 win over Punjab Kings. Ice in their veins, clarity in their plans and now, just one win away from rewriting history.

Pak's Babbar, Hindustan's Gabbar: BJP slams Revanth Reddy over Rafale remarkBJP leaders Amit Malviya and Sambit Patra slammed Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Revanth Reddy for questioning alleged Rafale losses during Operation Sindoor. They accused Congress of echoing Pakistan's line and undermining India's armed forces.

Amit Shah calls Pakistan coward for attacking civilians during Poonch visitUnion Home Minister Amit Shah visits Poonch to meet families affected by Pakistani shelling. He will also interact with BSF personnel and express gratitude for their role in Operation Sindoor.
Rare discovery on Mars could finally reveal why the planet diedScientists are interested in finding out how its once thick atmosphere got stripped away. They think sputtering was behind it.

sports.headline: PM Modi meets Vaibhav Suryavanshi after record-breaking IPL runIndian Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Vaibhav Suryavanshi and his family after the 14-year-old batter had an incredible campaign for Rajasthan Royals in the Indian Premier League 2025.

Shreyas Iyer didn't read the situation, needed to put ego in pocket: Tom MoodyFormer Australia cricketer turned commentator Tom Moody feels Shreyas Iyer failed to read the situation well during Punjab Kings' (PBKS) loss against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in Qualifier 1.

We went too hard upfront, a measured approach would've been wiser: James HopesPunjab Kings (PBKS) fast bowling coach James Hopes admitted that they went too hard upfront in the Qualifier 1 game against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB). Punjab got all out for just 101 in 14.1 overs as RCB went on to win the match by eight wickets.

What has changed in Shubman Gill's captaincy in IPL 2025? Sunil Gavaskar decodesSunil Gavaskar has explained what has changed with Shubman Gill's captaincy in IPL 2025. Gill has led from the front for Gujarat Titans this season as they made it to the playoffs with 9 wins out of 14 games.

Can Rohit Sharma break his playoff jinx? MI face big questions ahead of EliminatorMumbai Indians will need their hitman, Rohit Sharma, to score big as they take on Gujarat Titans in the Eliminator fixture of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). Rohit has had a mixed season so far as he has scored 329 runs from 13 innings at an average of 27.41 and a strike rate of 147.53.

India announce squad for historic mixed disability IT20 Series in EnglandThe Indian men's mixed disability team is set to face England in a seven-match IT20I series, starting June 21. Taunton, Wormsley, Worcester, Bristol and Lord's will host the matches.

IPL Qualifier 1: Virat Kohli's unmatched energy at 36 floors AB de VilliersAB de Villiers was in awe of Virat Kohli's unmatched energy at 36 as RCB reached the final of the IPL 2025 season. Kohli was lively on the field for RCB as they thrashed PBKS to reach the final.

Chasing 150-160 would have been tough: Josh HazlewoodIPL 2025, Qualifier 1, PBKS vs RCB: Josh Hazlewood said that the Royal Challengers Bengaluru would have struggled had Punjab Kings set a target in the range of 150 and 160 in Mullanpur. RCB beat PBKS by eight wickets on Thursday and secured their berth in the final.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
